entities.description: Module designed to measure whether respondents had experienced a major depressive episode (MDE) in their lifetime and past year.
Module designed to measure whether adolescent respondents had experienced a major depressive episode (MDE) in their lifetime and past year.
A period in which an individual experienced five or more of nine symptoms for MDE in the same 2-week period, including at least one symptom being a depressed mood or loss of interest or pleasure.
Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th Edition, which includes the criteria for assessing MDE symptoms.
National Comorbidity Survey-Replication, used as a source for adult MDE questions.
National Comorbidity Survey-Adolescent, used as a source for youth MDE questions.
An indicator of MDE, which includes nine attributes such as feeling sad, empty, depressed, discouraged, or loss of interest.
Statistics presented in the Results from the 2022 National Survey on Drug Use and Health: Detailed Tables.
Key Substance Use and Mental Health Indicators in the United States report.

relationships.description: NSDUH includes the adult depression module to assess MDE in respondents.
NSDUH includes the adolescent depression module to assess MDE in adolescent respondents.
The adult depression module assesses major depressive episodes in respondents.
The adolescent depression module assesses major depressive episodes in adolescent respondents.
The assessment of MDE symptoms uses criteria from the DSM-5.
Questions for adult MDE were adapted from the National Comorbidity Survey-Replication.
Questions for youth MDE were adapted from the National Comorbidity Survey-Adolescent.
Major depressive episodes are defined by the presence of nine attributes (symptoms).
The results from the 2022 survey present behavioral health statistics.
The Key Substance Use and Mental Health Indicators report includes behavioral health statistics.
